tit.e: Iohara no kuni miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)
tit.cmt: (government post) government postには違いないと思いますが、これだと中央官僚のようにも聞こえるので、regional governor in ancient Japan（古代日本の地域の統括者）としました。
tit.e: Iohara no kuni miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)

sen.j: 廬原国造（いおはらのくにみやつこ・いおはらこくぞう)は駿河国西部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Ioharano kunimiyatsuko 廬原国造 (also known as Ioharakokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the west part of Suruga Province.
Iohara no kuni miyatsuko (廬原国造), also known as Iohara kokuzo, was a kuni no miyatsuko that ruled the west part of Suruga Province.
Iohara no kuni miyatsuko (廬原国造), also known as Iohara kokuzo, was a kuni no miyatsuko that ruled the west part of Suruga Province.
It was also written as 五百原国造.
It was also written as 五百原国造.
It was also written as 五百原国造.

sen.j: 『新撰姓氏録』によると孝霊天皇の皇子稚武彦命で笠氏と同系。
sen.e: According to "Shinsen shojiroku", the ancestor was Wakatakehikonomikoto, a Prince of Emperor Korei, and Ioharano kunimiyatsuko was descended from the same line as the Kasa clan.
According to "Shinsen shojiroku", the ancestor is Wakatakehiko no mikoto, a Prince of Emperor Korei, and the Kasa clan is on the same line of family.
According to "Shinsen shojiroku," the ancestor is Wakatakehiko no mikoto, a Prince of Emperor Korei, and the Kasa clan is on the same line of family.

sen.j: 『古事記』では孝霊天皇の皇子日子刺肩別命の子で利波氏・国前氏などと同系。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki", Ioharano kunimiyatsuko was a son of Hikosashikatawakenomikoto, a Prince of Emperor Koken, and Ioharano kunimiyatsuko was descended from the same line as the Toshiba clan and the Kunisaki clan.
According to "Kojiki", Iohara no kunimiyatsuko is a son of Hikosashikatawake no mikoto, a Prince of Emperor Koken, having Toshiba and Kunisaki clans in the same line of family.
According to "Kojiki," Iohara no kunimiyatsuko is a son of Hikosashikatawake no mikoto, a Prince of Emperor Koken, having Toshiba and Kunisaki clans in the same line of family.

Kabane was Kimi (or Ko.)
Kabane, a family title granted by the authority, was Kimi (or Ko).

sen.j: 後に朝臣を賜った者もいた。
sen.e: Later, some member of the family were conferred on Ason.
Later, some member of the family were given a title Ason.

sen.e: Present Shizuoka City and Fuji City, Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 廬原臣 ...... 天智朝の武人。
sen.e: Ioharaomi: A warrior in the court during the reign of Emperor Tenji
Iohara omi: A warrior in the court during the reign of Emperor Tenji
Iohara omi: A warrior in the court during the reign of Emperor Tenji

sen.j: 白村江の戦いで阿倍比羅夫らとともに水軍を指揮したが敗れた。
sen.e: Ioharaomi commanded the Navy in cooperation with ABE no Hirafu in the Battle of Hakusukinoe, but was defeated.
Ioharaomi commanded the Navy in cooperation with ABE no Hirafu in the Battle of Hakusukinoe, but was defeated.
